questions.questionText: ___ I exercise every day?
___ she visit her parents on weekends?
Where ___ they live?
___ you go to work by bus?
What time ___ the meeting start?
Why ___ he always late?
___ you know how to solve this problem?
When ___ the store open every day?
How often ___ they meet?
What ___ you usually eat for breakfast?
___ it rain a lot here?
Why ___ we always have to wait?
What time ___ you go to bed?
Where ___ he work?
___ they like the new movie?
How ___ she know my name?
___ it usually snow in December?
What ___ they want to eat?
Why ___ I need to finish this today?
___ we have a meeting every Monday?
___ she working on the new project right now?
What ___ you doing at the moment?
___ they coming to the meeting?
Why ___ it raining so much these days?
___ you listening to the news?
___ they planning to visit us soon?
Where ___ we going tomorrow?
___ he playing football right now?
Who ___ they meeting later today?
Why ___ you always talking during class?
___ you finished your homework yet?
___ she visited that museum before?
What ___ they decided about the project?
___ he ever traveled to Europe?
How many times ___ you seen that movie?
___ they completed the assignment yet?
Where ___ she gone?
What ___ you learned in class today?
___ we met before this event?
Why ___ they not replied to your message?
___ the forecast called for rain, we decided to postpone the event.
She was late; ___, she apologized for the delay.
We went to the beach, ___ it was raining.
He studied hard; ___, he passed the exam with flying colors.
They didn’t win the match ___ they practiced every day.
The presentation was great; ___, the visuals were impressive.
He was tired, ___ he finished the marathon.
They decided to take the shortcut; ___, they got lost.
I stayed up late studying; ___, I was too tired to focus in class.
You should apologize; ___, things might get worse.
She is an excellent dancer, ___ she lacks confidence on stage.
I love the city; ___, it can be overwhelming at times.
___ she was busy, she still helped me with the project.
We must leave early ___ we will miss the train.
He is very talented; ___, he lacks the discipline to succeed.
She worked overtime; ___, she completed the project on time.
He didn’t study much, ___ he passed the test easily.
The movie was long; ___, it was very interesting.
She failed to meet the deadline; ___, she was not given another chance.
You should work harder; ___, you might not achieve your goals.
He was extremely tired; ___, he kept working late into the night.
The weather was perfect; ___, they decided to have a picnic.
___ it was raining, they went for a walk in the park.
She failed the exam the first time; ___, she passed it on her second attempt.
They wanted to finish the project by Friday; ___, they asked everyone to work overtime.
He didn't feel well, ___ he went to work anyway.
She loves reading fiction; ___, her brother prefers non-fiction.
We didn't arrive on time; ___, we missed the meeting.
He didn't have much experience; ___, he got the job.
We were supposed to meet at 6 p.m.; ___, she didn’t show up until 7 p.m.
He is a good singer; ___, he plays the piano beautifully.
She didn't study for the exam; ___, she managed to pass.
I have never been to Japan; ___, I’ve always wanted to visit.
They planned to go hiking; ___, the weather changed and they stayed home.
___ her effort, she didn’t get the promotion.
He forgot to set his alarm; ___, he woke up late.
He speaks Spanish fluently; ___, he struggles with French.
The food was delicious; ___, the service was excellent.
They were tired; ___, they continued to work until late at night.
We should leave now; ___, we might miss the train.
I forgot my umbrella; ___, I got soaked in the rain.
The team worked hard all year; ___, they won the championship.
I prefer quiet vacations; ___, my sister enjoys adventure trips.
He didn’t attend the meeting; ___, he missed the important announcement.
The teacher explained the concept again; ___, some students were still confused.
She worked hard for years; ___, she was promoted to manager.
He is very intelligent; ___, he has little practical experience.
___ I was tired, I kept working until the job was done.
He saved money for years; ___, he was able to buy a house.
You must submit your assignment by tomorrow; ___, you’ll lose marks.
There is ___ sugar in the jar.
I have ___ books on my desk.
She has ___ advice for you.
There are ___ chairs in the room.
Can I have ___ water?
I don’t need ___ help with this project.
How ___ apples are in the basket?
He bought ___ furniture for his new apartment.
I need ___ information about the trip.
There were ___ people at the event.
We have ___ time left to finish this.
How ___ money do we need?
He has ___ friends in the city.
Can you lend me ___ sugar?
She has ___ patience with her students.
There are only ___ cars on the road today.
He has ___ knowledge about this subject.
I don’t have ___ milk left.
How ___ chairs do we need?
He has only ___ bread in the pantry.
